experience: You and Doug both know Lynda Bishop, Richard Filley, and 10 others
You both worked at Northern Arizona University
Doug worked at Northern Arizona University after you started

As a Position, Navigation, and Timing engineer, I have become the subject matter expert for inertial systems and sensors at PreTalen. My responsibilities include: BOM Creation and hardware selection: micro-controllers, CPUs, sensors, batteriesProgramming to read sensors and GPS and implement algorithms: Python and CDesigning and 3D Printing enclosures to weatherize units
NinjaJOBO is a side project I am currently working on to remove the friction from the job-hunting experience. Site is not functional yet, but substantial progress has been made.

As a process engineer and tool-owner in the high-volume manufacture of computer chips, I was responsible for keeping production running at full capacity. Within months, I became the primary point of contact for a fleet of lithography machines processing approximately $1.2B worth of product weekly.

* I worked on validating risk and threat algorithms for major gas utility. Drastically increased efficiency through automation and workflow optimization. Work will provide reliable operation for natural gas system.* I created the original design for a hydrotest to qualify 4 miles of a natural gas pipeline. Project required rigorous attention to detail in order to meet every standard set by regulatory agencies, ASME, and the client.

Magnetic shape memory alloys are a new class of smart material with countless applications as power harvesters, sensors, and actuators. Key aspects of MSMAs include fast response time (>1khz), large recoverable nonlinear deformation (>6%), and precision (<.1mm).I developed a model and simulated the complex mechanical system of an MSMA and its response to magnetic loading and mechanical stress in 3-dimensions with Dr. Heidi Feigenbaum. This gave me valuable experience in:* Material characterization and structural mechanics* Using finite element analysis (FEA, sometimes called finite element method or FEM)* Simulating complex mechanical systems* Performing nonlinear computational modeling.
Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering with an emphasis in smart materials. Produced thesis in modeling the response of magnetic shape memory alloys (MSMAs).
Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering with an emphasis in smart materials. Produced thesis in modeling the response of magnetic shape memory alloys (MSMAs).

summary: I wake up every day and build technology to amplify the human experience. Whether building a new class of solar tracking device or simulating complex electro-mechanical systems using FEA (finite element analysis, also called FEM or finite element method), I am energized to work on tools that will 10x your daily output.Sound good? Send me an email or message.Other specialties include simulated nonlinear deformation, control algorithms, electromechanical systems and assemblies, experimental data acquisition, sensors, numerical simulation, smart materials, shape memory alloys (driven by magnetism, temperature, or stress), actuators, automation, structural mechanics, material characterization, computer aided design and manufacture (CAD models / CAM), Solidworks, research, power harvesting, energy harvesting, solar power, renewable energy, energy transport, and natural gas pipelines.
